definition: the particular portion of space occupied by something
walk_text:
Notary Clerk: "Returning? For an... urgent procurement? The Notariat can expedite the paperwork."
Notary Clerk: "The office closes at six. I suggest you conclude your business."
prose: The word **position** means the place where something is located. To find the **position** of an office, you look for its address. I hurried to the Notariat building, knowing its position was downtown. The clerk saw me and said, "[neutral] Notary Clerk: 'Returning? For an... urgent procurement? The Notariat can expedite the paperwork.'" I nodded. Then she added, "[neutral] Notary Clerk: 'The office closes at six. I suggest you conclude your business.'" I checked the clock's position on the wall and saw I had just enough time.

definition: the state of needing something that is absent or unavailable
walk_text:
Archivist-Principal: "Behold the Savage Vineyard, where my adjoints are tempered for a higher purpose: to administer Gallia Reborn."
Archivist-Principal: "So, the errand-runner of the Fifth Republic arrives at last."
prose: The Archivist-Principal was happy. "Behold the Savage Vineyard," he said. To **lack** something means you need it but do not have it. He explained his purpose: "to administer Gallia Reborn." Then he spoke to the visitor: "So, the errand-runner of the Fifth Republic arrives at last." The runner felt a sudden **lack** of courage. The strange vineyard and the principal's words made her feel unsafe and unsure.

definition: make an effort or attempt
walk_text:
Préfecture Inspector: "What was that sound?"
Chef de Bureau: "If the dossier is not stamped and returned by close of business, the Préfecture will recall Inspector Lex to the Quai. Finish the job. Now."
Chef de Bureau: "I heard the Renard Gris personally embarrassed Lex years ago when he tried to audit the Comte de Champagne for 'irregularities.' Lex has never forgotten."
"Though I must confess, I was concerned about the complexity of the dossiers. The regulations have become... labyrinthine."
Bureaucrat Fournier: "It's worse than the audit reports! In fact, it's as if the worst projections have been validated!"
prose: To **try** means to make an effort or attempt to do something. The Chef de Bureau explained why Inspector Lex is so motivated, saying, "I heard the Renard Gris personally embarrassed Lex years ago when he **tried** to audit the Comte." Lex's attempt failed, and now he is trying to get revenge through strict rules. Bureaucrat Fournier is afraid of those rules, saying, "It's worse than the audit reports!" The staff must try their hardest to finish the dossiers on time.

definition: including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or...
walk_text:
Civilian: "They say the Durendal is dismantled, but I'm staying near the Préfecture—just in case."
Civilian: "They say the Durendal is dismantled, but I'm staying near the Préfecture—just in case."
Civilian: "They say the Durendal is dismantled, but I'm staying near the Préfecture—just in case."
Civilian: "Wait, isn't that the Préfet's aide?"
prose: The word **whole** means something complete, with nothing missing or broken. To be whole is to be in one piece. The civilians in the city were afraid. They had heard the giant defense weapon, the Durendal, was taken apart. One kept saying, "[fear] They say the Durendal is dismantled, but I'm staying near the Préfecture—just in case." They did not feel safe. They wished the defensive system was still **whole** and could protect the entire city. Then someone noticed an official and whispered, "[neutral] Wait, isn't that the Préfet's aide?"

definition: the coldest season of the year; in the northern hemisphere it extends from the winter solstice to...
walk_text:
Archivist-Principal: "Behold the Savage Vineyard, where my adjoints are tempered for a higher purpose: to administer Gallia Reborn."
Archivist-Principal: "So, the errand-runner of the Fifth Republic arrives at last."
prose: The Archivist-Principal was happy. "Behold the Savage Vineyard," he said, "where my adjoints are tempered for a higher purpose." To be tempered is to be made stronger by enduring a hard season, like winter. Winter means the coldest time of year, a period of waiting. "So, the errand-runner arrives at last," he finished. The visitor shivered, feeling the cold of this artificial winter in the vineyard. It was a chill meant to forge loyal servants for his "Gallia Reborn."

definition: not of long duration; having just (or relatively recently) come into being or been made or acquired...
walk_text:
Bureaucratic Colleague: "There's been a serious procedural breach at the École Normale. I heard a senior adjoint was terminated following an unscheduled field review."
Bureaucratic Colleague: "I believe the reports about Durendal operatives are completely unsubstantiated. I've read some wild dossiers, and I don't credit any of them."
Bureaucratic Colleague: "The Hexagon's oversight committee seems particularly focused on this new Durendal cell that's appeared. I'm curious how the compliance review will proceed."
Bureaucratic Colleague: "Have you seen any of the classified addenda to the Hexagon's report on these Durendals? The documentation doesn't line up."
prose: In this office, to be **new** means to have just arrived or been made. The talk was all about a recent report. One colleague said, "The Hexagon's oversight committee seems particularly focused on this **new** Durendal cell that's appeared." Everyone was worried because this group was not of long duration. Its files were a mystery. Another asked, "Have you seen any of the classified addenda...? The documentation doesn't line up." The **new** situation was causing much confusion.

definition: used to form the comparative of some adjectives and adverbs
walk_text:
Préfecture Usher: "Hmm... your attire is borderline, but your disposition is agreeable. I'll permit entry. I trust this won't require additional paperwork."
Préfecture Usher: "Right. A Préfecture gala. You seem pleasant enough, but not sufficiently credentialed for automatic admission. And certainly not dressed like that."
Préfecture Usher: "Look, this is a formal reception. You seem adequate, but not so distinguished that I'd bypass protocol. At least not presenting yourself like that."
Préfecture Usher: "This is a Hexagon-sanctioned event. I don't know you. I don't trust your documentation. And your attire is non-compliant regardless."
prose: To be **more** means to have a greater amount or degree. The Préfecture Usher was looking for guests who were **more** distinguished. He told one hopeful guest, "You seem pleasant enough, but not sufficiently credentialed for automatic admission. And certainly not dressed like that." To another, he explained, "You seem adequate, but not so distinguished that I'd bypass protocol." The guard’s job was to decide who was important enough, or **more** suitable, to enter the formal gala.

definition: have the quality of being; (copula, used with an adjective or a predicate noun)
walk_text:
"This stamp—it's the wrong color. The entire submission is now non-compliant."
"Stationary observation? But the quarterly review is tomorrow. If I'm not present for my performance assessment..."
"Your assessment has been pre-determined. The forms have already been processed. Section 7, paragraph 3: 'Terminal status pending physical verification.'"
Petitioner: "Remain? Are you mad? My dossier will be stamped 'Terminated'! Take me with you, I beg you — the paperwork will follow!"
"Now, about the witness requirements... I must insist on proper protocol. The Préfecture's standards cannot be compromised."
prose: To **be** is to exist or to have a certain quality. In the bureaucratic world of the Préfecture, to **be** compliant is everything. A petitioner learned this too late. "This stamp—it's the wrong color. The entire submission is now non-compliant," an official stated. The petitioner’s fear grew when told, "Your assessment has been pre-determined." He cried, "My dossier will be stamped 'Terminated'!" But the official was unmoved, insisting, "The Préfecture's standards cannot be compromised." For him, the rule was all that had to be.

definition: engage in
walk_text:
Archivist-Principal: "Why do you think your département has always been contested ground, the arena of Préfets and Généraux?"
Archivist-Principal: "Well filed, petitioner. Your progress is noted and efficient. Perhaps your request will reach my desk after all."
Archivist-Principal: "Behold the Savage Vineyard, where my adjoints are tempered for a higher purpose: to administer Gallia Reborn."
Archivist-Principal: "So, the errand-runner of the Fifth Republic arrives at last."
prose: To **do** something means to engage in an action or a task. The Archivist-Principal asked, "Why **do** you think your département has always been contested ground?" This question made the visitor think about the work they **do**. Later, the Archivist said, "Your progress is noted and efficient." He was pleased with the work the visitor came to **do**. He showed the Savage Vineyard, where his adjoints **do** hard training to learn how to administer Gallia Reborn.

definition: the statement (oral or written) of an exchange of promises
walk_text:
Civilian: "They say the Durendal is dismantled, but I'm staying near the Préfecture—just in case."
Civilian: "They say the Durendal is dismantled, but I'm staying near the Préfecture—just in case."
Civilian: "They say the Durendal is dismantled, but I'm staying near the Préfecture—just in case."
Civilian: "Wait, isn't that the Préfet's aide?"
prose: An **agreement** means a promise people make to each other. It can be spoken or written. The civilians were worried because they didn’t trust the city’s **agreement** to take the weapon apart. One said, "They say the Durendal is dismantled, but I'm staying near the Préfecture—just in case." Another noticed an official and whispered, "Wait, isn't that the Préfet's aide?" They hoped the aide would keep the city’s agreement and prove their fears were wrong.

definition: feel or have a desire for; want strongly
walk_text:
Archivist: "Je vous en prie ! Non ! Non !!"
Archivist: "Non... non... pas encore..."
Archivist: "Je le mérite... tout cela..."
prose: To want is to feel a strong desire for something. The Archivist, trapped and afraid, did not want the pain to return. As he cried out, "Je vous en prie ! Non ! Non !!" and "Non... non... pas encore...", his fear was clear. But in his final whisper, "Je le mérite... tout cela...", he showed a deeper, sadder truth. Sometimes, a person can want punishment because they believe they deserve it. He did not want the suffering, yet some part of him wanted the pain he felt was his due.

definition: having desirable or positive qualities especially those suitable for a thing specified
walk_text:
Préfecture Inspector: "What was that sound?"
Chef de Bureau: "If the dossier is not stamped and returned by close of business, the Préfecture will recall Inspector Lex to the Quai. Finish the job. Now."
Chef de Bureau: "I heard the Renard Gris personally embarrassed Lex years ago when he tried to audit the Comte de Champagne for 'irregularities.' Lex has never forgotten."
"Though I must confess, I was concerned about the complexity of the dossiers. The regulations have become... labyrinthine."
Bureaucrat Fournier: "It's worse than the audit reports! In fact, it's as if the worst projections have been validated!"
prose: In this office, to be **good** means to finish your work correctly and on time. The Chef de Bureau reminded everyone of this when he said, "If the dossier is not stamped and returned by close of business, the Préfecture will recall Inspector Lex." The workers were worried because the rules were so confusing. Bureaucrat Fournier complained, "It's worse than the audit reports!" They knew a **good** result would keep the inspector away, so they worked quickly to meet the deadline.

definition: come together
walk_text:
Préfecture Official: "{Player's aiming at her}I don't appreciate having my person documented in that manner."
"But enough about that fool. The real problem is the device itself."
Arena Announcer / Master of Proceedings: "Citizens, we have a result! Witness the combatant from the Bleu Contingent! All wagers placed on Bleu may be collected at the Bureau des Parieurs."
Arena Announcer / Master of Proceedings: "Let your voices be heard as we authorize the commencement of proceedings! These two petitioners now face their administrative review!"
"{Voice dropping to a murmur} Sometimes the only response left is... nothing. Just the hollow space where a protest should be."
prose: To meet is to come together. The two petitioners in the arena were about to meet for their battle. The official announced, "Let your voices be heard as we authorize the commencement of proceedings! These two petitioners now face their administrative review!" The crowd roared as the fighters began to meet each other's attacks. Later, a murmur in the stands suggested a different kind of meeting: "Sometimes the only response left is... nothing. Just the hollow space where a protest should be."

definition: the (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
walk_text:
Préfecture Official: "{Player's aiming at her}I don't appreciate having my person documented in that manner."
"But enough about that fool. The real problem is the device itself."
Arena Announcer / Master of Proceedings: "Citizens, we have a result! Witness the combatant from the Bleu Contingent! All wagers placed on Bleu may be collected at the Bureau des Parieurs."
Arena Announcer / Master of Proceedings: "Let your voices be heard as we authorize the commencement of proceedings! These two petitioners now face their administrative review!"
"{Voice dropping to a murmur} Sometimes the only response left is... nothing. Just the hollow space where a protest should be."
prose:
To **hand** something to a person means to pass it to them using the part of your arm that can grasp. Your hand is the extremity that holds things.

In the arena, the official did not want his picture taken. He said, "I don't appreciate having my person documented in that manner." Later, the announcer raised a **hand** for quiet before declaring, "Citizens, we have a result!"

definition: judge or regard; look upon; judge
walk_text:
Archivist-Principal: "Why do you think your département has always been contested ground, the arena of Préfets and Généraux?"
Archivist-Principal: "Well filed, petitioner. Your progress is noted and efficient. Perhaps your request will reach my desk after all."
Archivist-Principal: "Behold the Savage Vineyard, where my adjoints are tempered for a higher purpose: to administer Gallia Reborn."
Archivist-Principal: "So, the errand-runner of the Fifth Republic arrives at last."
prose: To **think** means to judge or form an opinion. The Archivist-Principal asked, "Why do you **think** your département has always been contested ground?" He wanted the petitioner to consider the reasons. Later, he said, "Your progress is noted." The petitioner had to **think** carefully about his next move. He saw the Savage Vineyard and heard, "Behold... where my adjoints are tempered." He began to **think** the Archivist’s goals were complex and strange.

definition: the part of the day between noon and evening
walk_text:
Archivist-Principal: "Behold the Savage Vineyard, where my adjoints are tempered for a higher purpose: to administer Gallia Reborn."
Archivist-Principal: "So, the errand-runner of the Fifth Republic arrives at last."
prose:
The **afternoon** means the time between noon and evening. The sun was low in the **afternoon** sky when I reached the strange garden. A figure waited for me, looking pleased.

"[happy] Behold the Savage Vineyard, where my adjoints are tempered for a higher purpose: to administer Gallia Reborn," the Archivist-Principal said. "[happy] So, the errand-runner of the Fifth Republic arrives at last."

His words were cheerful, but they made the warm air feel cold.

definition: prior to a specified or implied time
walk_text:
"This stamp—it's the wrong color. The entire submission is now non-compliant."
"Stationary observation? But the quarterly review is tomorrow. If I'm not present for my performance assessment..."
"Your assessment has been pre-determined. The forms have already been processed. Section 7, paragraph 3: 'Terminal status pending physical verification.'"
Petitioner: "Remain? Are you mad? My dossier will be stamped 'Terminated'! Take me with you, I beg you — the paperwork will follow!"
"Now, about the witness requirements... I must insist on proper protocol. The Préfecture's standards cannot be compromised."
prose: To say something has **already** happened means it has taken place before now. In the office, the worker’s fate was sealed because the forms had **already** been processed. A voice explained, "Your assessment has been pre-determined. The forms have already been processed." There was nothing left to change. The petitioner cried, “My dossier will be stamped 'Terminated'!” But it was too late. The decision was made in the past.

definition: have the quality of being; (copula, used with an adjective or a predicate noun)
walk_text:
"This stamp—it's the wrong color. The entire submission is now non-compliant."
"Stationary observation? But the quarterly review is tomorrow. If I'm not present for my performance assessment..."
"Your assessment has been pre-determined. The forms have already been processed. Section 7, paragraph 3: 'Terminal status pending physical verification.'"
Petitioner: "Remain? Are you mad? My dossier will be stamped 'Terminated'! Take me with you, I beg you — the paperwork will follow!"
"Now, about the witness requirements... I must insist on proper protocol. The Préfecture's standards cannot be compromised."
prose: To **be** means to exist or to have a certain quality. In the rigid Préfecture, your fate could **be** decided by a single mistake. A petitioner learned this after an error with a form. "This stamp—it's the wrong color. The entire submission is now non-compliant," said a voice. The petitioner panicked, crying, "My dossier will be stamped 'Terminated'!" But the official was unmoved, stating, "The Préfecture's standards cannot be compromised." In that world, to be compliant was to be safe.

definition: a person who works at a specific occupation
walk_text:
Préfecture Official: "{Player's aiming at her}I don't appreciate having my person documented in that manner."
"But enough about that fool. The real problem is the device itself."
Arena Announcer / Master of Proceedings: "Citizens, we have a result! Witness the combatant from the Bleu Contingent! All wagers placed on Bleu may be collected at the Bureau des Parieurs."
Arena Announcer / Master of Proceedings: "Let your voices be heard as we authorize the commencement of proceedings! These two petitioners now face their administrative review!"
"{Voice dropping to a murmur} Sometimes the only response left is... nothing. Just the hollow space where a protest should be."
prose: A **worker** means a person who does a specific job. Every worker has a role. The arena announcer, a worker who runs the show, declared, "Citizens, we have a result!" But another worker, the Préfecture Official, was upset. She snapped, "I don't appreciate having my person documented in that manner." She felt disrespected, not treated like a professional worker should be. Sometimes, the only response to such treatment is silence, "Just the hollow space where a protest should be."

definition: preserve in a can or tin
walk_text:
Notary Clerk: "Returning? For an... urgent procurement? The Notariat can expedite the paperwork."
Notary Clerk: "The office closes at six. I suggest you conclude your business."
prose: To **can** means to preserve food by sealing it in a metal container. The notary clerk offered to help. "The Notariat **can** expedite the paperwork," he said. He then added, "The office closes at six. I suggest you conclude your business." I realized I needed to hurry home. I had a long afternoon ahead of me, planning to **can** the fresh tomatoes from my garden before they spoiled.

definition: a period of time containing 365 (or 366) days
walk_text:
Préfecture Inspector: "What was that sound?"
Chef de Bureau: "If the dossier is not stamped and returned by close of business, the Préfecture will recall Inspector Lex to the Quai. Finish the job. Now."
Chef de Bureau: "I heard the Renard Gris personally embarrassed Lex years ago when he tried to audit the Comte de Champagne for 'irregularities.' Lex has never forgotten."
"Though I must confess, I was concerned about the complexity of the dossiers. The regulations have become... labyrinthine."
Bureaucrat Fournier: "It's worse than the audit reports! In fact, it's as if the worst projections have been validated!"
prose: A **year** means a period of 365 days, or 366 in a leap year. It is how we measure long stretches of time. The Chef de Bureau explained that Inspector Lex holds a grudge for a very long time. "I heard the Renard Gris personally embarrassed Lex **years** ago," he said happily. This meant the event happened many full cycles of the calendar in the past. The memory of that old failure still drives Lex’s actions this **year**, making the bureaucrats fear his return.
